Emphasizing equal treatment for all players, Gambhir aims to rebuild Indian cricket legacies.

title: Delhi-based tech CEO shares “peak Bengaluru” moment
description: Ananya Narang, CEO of Entourage, recently experienced a virtual receptionist at a Bengaluru hotel, calling it a 'Peak Bengaluru' moment. This tech-forward approach replaces physical front desk staff with virtual receptionists, sparking mixed reactions online. While some praised the innovation in hospitality, others lamented the loss of personal touch that is needed in hospitality.

title: Sensex vs China stocks: CLSA sees 3 ‘witches’ in Indian markets!
description: Global investors are flocking to Chinese equities, prompted by aggressive measures from Beijing to revive its market. CLSA has reduced its Indian equity exposure to increase investment in China.

title: Coal mine blast in West Bengal's Birbhum, three killed
PM Modi posts video of ‘memorable moments’ during Mumbai Metro ride
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a ride on the newly inaugurated Aarey JVLR to BKC section of Mumbai Metro Line 3, interacting with commuters and experiencing a musical performance. This expansion, costing Rs 14,120 crore, enhances connectivity in Mumbai and is expected to serve 12 lakh passengers daily.

title: Govt warns of pension scam: How fraudsters are targeting people on WA
description: With the Jeevan Pramaan certificate deadline nearing, scammers are targeting pensioners on WhatsApp, claiming to be government officials. Fake messages request personal information, risking identity theft and fraud. Official updates will not be given via WhatsApp; pensioners should report suspicious messages to authorities and contact their bank or CPAO directly for queries.

title: 'I cannot see but my hands can detect breast cancer': Blind woman saves lives
description: Meenakshi Gupta, a visually impaired Medical Tactile Examiner in Gurugram, excels in detecting tiny breast lumps using her heightened sense of touch, improving early breast cancer detection. Working with Medanta Hospital, she has examined over 1,100 patients, identifying hundreds of cases needing further attention, aiding significantly in breast cancer awareness and early diagnosis.

title: 'Singham Again' trailer: Ajay Devgn makes return with Lady Singham Deepika
description: The next chapter in Rohit Shetty's highly anticipated Cop Universe is all set to unfold on the big screen this Diwali and head of the launch, the ensemble star cast got together to unveil the action-packed trailer in Mumbai City. Amidst much hype and anticipation, the 'Singham Again' trailer finally released online and its safe to say it lived up to all expectations.

title: 2 dead, 3 struggling for life after consuming 'Vada' in UP's Mirzapur
description: Two members of a family in Mirzapur district died and three others fell ill after consuming Vada at home. The deceased include an elderly woman and a minor girl. The remaining family members are receiving treatment at a local hospital. Authorities have sent food samples for testing to ascertain the cause of the incident.

description: Asteroids can be transformed into food for astronauts on deep space mission, says a study

title: Ranveer Singh gets into Super-Dad mode, swoops in to protect child from crowd at 'Singham Again' trailer launch
description: Ranveer Singh sprang into action at the 'Singham Again' trailer launch to assist a lost girl in a crowd. He comforted and reunited her with her mother. He also shared that his newborn daughter with Deepika Padukone made her debut in the movie, filmed during the actress' pregnancy. The film releases in cinemas on Diwali 2024.

title: Ratan Tata's Instagram post gives a health update: There is no cause of concern...
description: Ratan Tata, the 86-year-old former chairman of Tata Sons, dispelled rumours about his health, clarifying he isn't hospitalised. While undergoing routine check-ups due to age-related conditions, he assured the public of his good health and spirits. Tata also urged media and public to refrain from spreading misinformation to prevent unnecessary speculation.

title: 2 dead, 3 injured in firecracker explosion in UP's Gonda
description: A firecracker explosion in Gonda district killed two and critically injured three others. Police revealed the group was illegally making firecrackers in a house in Belasar village. The blast damaged nearby homes. Authorities are conducting an investigation, and forensic and bomb detection teams are collecting evidence at the scene.

title: Paytm focusing on consumer payments business: CEO
description: Fintech firm Paytm is prioritizing investment in its consumer payments business to recover from a user base decline after RBI's restrictions. CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma emphasizes a renewed focus on UPI payments and merchant transactions, aiming to leverage the TPAP business model for growth.

title: RRB JE Exam Date 2024 Released at rrbapply.gov.in; Check official notice here
description: The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) has released exam dates for the Junior Engineer (JE) recruitment under CEN-03/2024, scheduled from 6th to 13th December 2024. A total of 7,934 vacancies will be filled for JE, Depot Material Superintendent, and Chemical & Metallurgical Assistant posts. The RRB has also provided exam schedules for ALP, RPF-SI, and Technician roles. Candidates can download e-call letters and check exam city details on the official RRB website.

title: 8 Creative and delightful ways to include Raw Papaya in the daily diet
description: Raw papaya, widely used in Indian and Oriental cuisines, offers numerous health benefits, including improved digestion, reduced inflammation, and weight management. Rich in nutrients and antioxidants, it can be enjoyed in salads, pickles, soups, stir-fries, curries, salsas, sabzi, and stews, making it a versatile and healthy addition to any diet.

title: Nobel Prize 2024 in Medicine announced: Victor Ambros, Gary Ruvkun awarded for discovering microRNA
description: Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun have been awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for discovering microRNAs, tiny RNA molecules crucial for gene regulation. Their research on C. elegans unveiled a new layer of genetic control vital for multicellular organisms. MicroRNAs hold significant diagnostic and therapeutic potential, influencing treatments for cancer and other diseases.

title: Tiger being the symbol of soil fertility replaces the lion at Kunda bari's Durga Puja
description: The Kundu Bari Hatibagan family celebrates Durga Puja as a tribute to nature and its ecosystem. They use biodegradable materials for their idol and decorations, aligning with their belief in Mother Earth and wildlife conservation. Their traditions emphasize the interconnectedness of all life forms.

title: RBI likely to keep rates steady as economic growth slows, global rates ease: Report
description: The Reserve Bank of India is expected to maintain the 6.5% repo rate, with some speculating a shift to neutral potentially leading to future rate cuts. Despite slow economic growth and easing global rates, inflation stays below the central bank's target. The monetary policy committee's new members might influence future rate decisions.

title: New York Giants’ Head Coach Brian Daboll Was Caught Furious as He Thought the Officials Missed a Call on a Key Play
description: The New York Giants secured a 29-20 victory over the Seattle Seahawks, thanks to a strategic play designed by special teams coach Michael Ghobrial. Isaiah Simmons blocked the kick, leading to a critical touchdown. Despite a sideline meltdown, head coach Brian Daboll credited Jones’ performance and the tactical execution for their success.

title: Chempaneer Poovu: Rebecca Santhosh replaces Gomathi Priya, set to play Revathi
description: Rebecca Santhosh is set to replace Gomathi Priya as Revathi in the popular Malayalam TV show 'Chempaneer Poovu.' Her entry has stirred mixed reactions among fans who appreciated Gomathi's portrayal. The reason for Gomathi’s departure remains unknown.

title: Indianapolis Colts Right Guard Will Fries Will be Undergoing Surgery for Fractured Right Tibia
description: The Indianapolis Colts ended the Steelers' win streak and the Jaguars' losing streak in a game marked by Joe Flacco's performance. Despite his 359-yards and three touchdowns, the Colts lost. Right guard Will Fries suffered a season-ending leg injury and will undergo surgery. The Colts face additional challenges with multiple key players injured.

description: Mohun Bagan Super Giants are "considered to be withdrawn" from the AFC Champions League Two after refusing to travel to Iran for safety reasons following the death of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah. As per AFC rules, all matches played by Mohun Bagan are cancelled.

title: The average primary camera resolution of smartphones has reached its highest level yet in 2024
description: In Q2 2024, over half of smartphones shipped feature cameras with 50MP or higher resolutions, reflecting consumer demand for superior photography. The average primary camera resolution has doubled since Q2 2020.

description: Team India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, arrived in New Delhi ahead of their second T20 International against Bangladesh after securing a 1-0 lead in the series. title: How Putin’s ‘Merchant of Death’ is complicating Middle-East War for USA and Israel
description: Viktor Bout, a notorious Russian arms dealer released in 2022, is complicating the Middle Eastern conflict, particularly for the U.S. and Israel. Bout's reported arms deals with Yemen's Iran-backed Houthis heighten tensions, threatening U.S. military operations and Israeli defence strategies. These arms transfers, including potential advanced weapons, could shift the region’s power dynamics, further destabilising the area. Bout’s resurgence reflects Russia’s growing alignment with Iran, raising concerns about Moscow's role in escalating proxy wars in the region. His involvement underscores the ongoing challenges in controlling illicit arms networks.

title: Hamas attack first anniversary, October 7: Know what happened and series of events

description: Ralf Schumacher's $8 million villa listing has sparked outrage from his ex-wife, Cora. Meanwhile, Ralf reflected on their brother Michael's long road to recovery following a severe skiing accident in 2013 and emphasized the emotional toll the accident has taken on the family.

With an estimated value of around Rs. 15,000 crores, it is said to be one of the landmarks in the city of Indian metropolitans.

The Health Minister confirmed five deaths and 102 heat-related issues. Measures like water and ambulances were provided, and precautions were advised by the IAF.

description: The Buffalo Bills' loss to the Houston Texans is blamed on poor coaching and questionable handling of quarterback Josh Allen's potential concussion. Experts and fans criticize the NFL's concussion protocol, comparing Allen's situation to Tua Tagovailoa's recent concussion injury.

title: Russia court sentences 72-year-old US citizen for mercenary activities in Ukraine
description: A Russian court sentenced American Stephen James Hubbard, 72, to six years and 10 months for mercenary activities in Ukraine. Detained in April 2022, Hubbard was accused of receiving payment for serving in a Ukrainian defense unit and pleaded guilty during a secret trial in Moscow.

title: Weather may delay launch of mission to study deflected asteroid
description: Stormy weather might postpone the launch of Europe's Hera spacecraft, aimed at analyzing the aftermath of NASA's DART collision with the asteroid Dimorphos. Scheduled for Monday, the mission's objective is to gather crucial data on planetary defense. If postponed, a back-up launch is set for Tuesday. The launch window extends until October 27.

title: Dreaming of Maa Durga: Know its spiritual meaning
description: Dreams of goddess Durga are very auspicious and hold deep spiritual significance. These dreams symbolize divine protection, strength, courage, balance, inner feminine energy, and the removal of negative energy. The presence of Durga in dreams suggests that you are being guided and transformed positively, helping you overcome obstacles and find inner peace.

title: This popular writer draws inspiration from her daily struggles with brain cancer
description: Glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer, originates in the brain's supportive tissue, known as glial cells. It is the most common malignant brain tumor in adults and has a rapid growth rate, making it difficult to treat. The common symptoms associated with glioblastoma include headaches, seizures, cognitive impairments, and neurological deficits, depending on the tumor’s location. Despite treatment options like surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy, glioblastoma tends to recur, and prognosis remains poor.

title: Nita Ambani's school visit: A lesson in style and motherly grace
description: Nita Ambani recently visited her grandson Prithvi Ambani's school and engaged with children, showcasing her warm and elegant persona. Dressed in a rani pink kurta with golden embroidery, she balanced tradition and modernity flawlessly. Her choice of understated makeup and chic accessories highlighted her sophisticated style, making her an inspiration for many.

title: Vikings' Aaron Jones Exits London Game Early After Sustaining Hip Injury, Ruled Out for the Remainder

Vikings coach Kevin O'Connell hopes his absence will be short-term. Jones, a key player with past injury concerns, will benefit from an upcoming bye week before potentially returning against the Detroit Lions.

title: Singapore's Indian-origin ex-minister Iswaran begins 1-yr jail term for corruption; apologises to nation

He was sentenced for accepting illegal gifts worth about USD 313,200 and obstructing justice. Iswaran apologized publicly and expressed the emotional toll on his family as a reason for not pursuing a lengthy trial.

title: Ukraine says hit oil facility in Crimea
description: Ukraine said Monday its forces had struck an oil terminal overnight on the Crimean peninsula -- seized by Moscow in 2014 -- in Kyiv's latest attack on Russian-controlled energy facilities. Russian forces launched several missiles and dozens of drones overnight at Ukraine, the air force in Kyiv said, with two missiles shot down over the capital and the third exploding near an airfield in the central Khmelnytskyi region.

title: Jr NTR starrer 'Devara: Part 1' collects Rs 466 crore globally in ten days

Directed by Koratala Siva, the action-packed drama also stars Janhvi Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan in key roles. The film follows criminal activities in a coastal community, with Jr NTR playing the double role of Devara and Vardha.

Key conferences include biodiversity in Colombia, climate change in Azerbaijan, desertification in Saudi Arabia, and plastic pollution in South Korea. These meetings aim to secure significant agreements and strategies to address the urgent threats facing our planet.

title: Berhampur University Takes Action Against 17 Students for Alleged Ragging; Hostel Evictions, Fines Imposed After UGC Complaint

Following an anti-ragging committee investigation, four students were evicted from their hostel, and 13 others were fined ₹1,000 each. The action was taken after a complaint was forwarded by the UGC, with the university also issuing warnings to prevent future incidents.

It underscores the need for customized nutritional plans for seniors, particularly those with restrictive diets or social isolation, to enhance their overall well-being.

Government to sell tomatoes at Rs 65/kg
description: The government has started selling tomatoes through mobile vans at Rs 65 per kilogram to contain the price of the kitchen essential through retail outlets of the National Cooperative Consumers’ Federation of India (NCCF), NAFED and Safal in Delhi and neighbouring cities.Tomato prices have skyrocketed, with the vegetable now selling at over Rs 100 per kg in several markets as unseasonal rains damaged the tomato crop in key farming areas in Maharashtra.The modal price - a type of average price calculated by the government - of tomatoes increased 39% in October compared to the previous month to Rs 62 per kg from Rs 44 per kg last month in the retail market and to Rs 5045 per quintal from Rs 3562 per quintal in the whole sale market, according to government data.According to a recent report by rating agency Crisil, the cost of home cooked vegetarian thali surged 11% year-on-year in September mainly on account of high vegetable prices.The centre has launched this market intervention under the price stabilisation fund to manage rising tomato prices in the retail market. In July, food minister Pralhad Joshi initiated a similar move, selling tomatoes at Rs 60/kg to control price hikes.Traders and farmers said that sowing for kharif tomato is lagging behind in Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh compared to the previous year. The intensity of pests and diseases in tomatoes have also been reported to be above the economic threshold level in Maharashtra, causing a dip in supply.Vegetable prices usually increase during the monsoon season as rainfall affects harvesting, including plucking and packaging. Additionally, transport disruptions lead to increased vegetable wastage, further impacting prices. This year, severe heat wave also damaged crops in the main producing areas.

description: The 33-year-old, whose India career came to an abrupt halt after an underwhelming debut in the 2021 T20 World Cup, took three wickets against Bangladesh in the series opener.

description: A leopard safari at Bannerghatta National Park near the Bannerghatta National Park in Karnataka turned adventurous for a group of tourists after the wild animal leapt at the window of their bus, leaving them stunned.

title: Gurugram Mall Owner Reacts To Zomato CEO's Experience While Collecting Order
description: The owner of Ambience Mall, Gurugram, took corrective action after Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal shared his experience of picking up food from restaurants at the mall, where he alleged that he was stopped from using the lift while picking up the order.

title: Election Results LIVE: BJP Crosses Halfway Mark In Haryana, Trails In J&K
description: Election Results 2024 LIVE Updates: Votes are being counted for 90 Assembly seats each in Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Haryana Results Live Updates: BJP Fights Back In Haryana, Ahead Of Congress
description: Haryana Assembly Election Results 2024: The counting of votes cast in the Haryana Assembly elections has begun, with the ruling BJP eyeing a third consecutive term, leading Congress.

title: J&K Election Results 2024 LIVE: Congress-NC Alliance Crosses Halfway Mark
description: J&K Election Results 2024: The Congress and National Conference alliance crosses the halfway mark in Union Territory Jammu & Kashmir, show early leads.

title: BJP Claws Back To Haryana Lead, Congress-National Conference Ahead in J&K
description: Early rounds of counting of votes in Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir point to good news for the Congress and its ally National Conference in Jammu and Kashmir, and a close contest in Haryana

description: The Blaze Star was first recorded in 1217 in Germany by a man named Burchard from Ursberg.

title: "Last Time Around...": Omar Abdullah Posts Selfie On J&K Counting Day
description: National Conference (NC) leader Omar Abdullah has posted a selfie on vote-counting day in Jammu and Kashmir, one of the two newest Union Territories.

description: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, India played brilliantly till the semi-finals but faltered in the last four stage. However, India rose to the challenge in the bronze medal match to beat Spain 2-1

description: Juned Khan, the fast bowler from Kannauj, moved to Mumbai in order to find a job that can help him support his family.

title: After Mayank Debut, Ex-Pak Star Gives Big Verdict On India's Medical Team
description: Mayank Yadav recovered from injury problems, and made his T20I debut against Bangladesh.

title: Earthquakes In Iran And Israel Fuel Theories Of Covert Nuclear Testing
description: The unusual timing of the earthquakes, coupled with the ongoing geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran, led to speculations about a covert nuclear test being conducted.

title: Court Dismisses Plea Against Swami Rambhadracharya For Remarks On ST, SC
description: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed an appeal filed against alleged objectionable comments made against Dalits by a seer during a religious talk event.

title: "Why Not?" Farooq Abdullah On Post-Poll Alliance After J&K Poll, Rival Says...
description: The National Conference is open to a strategic post-poll alliance with the People's Democratic Party to keep the BJP out of power after the 2024 Jammu and Kashmir Assembly election, NC leader and ex Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah said.

title: J&K Lt Governor's Power To Nominate MLAs Sparks Row Ahead of Poll Results
description: The Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor's power to nominate five members to the assembly sparked a massive row ahead of the counting of votes today.

title: The Nobel Prizes: What is the point?
description: Dubbed the “Mount Everest of science”, the Prize faces criticism for how it chooses winners. Is it relevant in an era of global research?

title: Julana assembly constituency results: Vinesh Phogat trails by more than 2,000 votes
Bharti Airtel may buy another 'loss-making' Tata Group company, after 7 yrs
description: Bharti Airtel is in advanced talks with Tata Group to acquire Tata Play, aiming to consolidate its digital TV presence and enhance bundled offerings. This acquisition follows Bharti's 2017 purchase of Tata's consumer mobility business and addresses the growing competition and decline in DTH services due to OTT platforms.

title: Infamous ‘bride bazaar’ of Hyderabad takes digital turn
description: Fatima, 22, marries a man nearly thrice her age to fund her grandmother's hospital stay and her sister's education. Meanwhile, Justice Lokur's inquiry commission on power deals faces uncertainties, with its term set to end on October 31 without clear progress.

title: Women's T20 WC: How result of NZ vs AUS will impact India's semis chances
description: India's women's cricket team faces a challenging path in the ICC Women's T20 World Cup after a heavy loss to New Zealand and a win against Pakistan. Their chances of advancing depend on the outcome of the New Zealand-Australia match, necessitating wins in their remaining games to better their net run rate and secure a semifinal spot.

title: Haryana and J&K assembly election result highlights: Who is leading/trailing from where
description: In the closely contested Haryana assembly elections, early trends show BJP and Congress neck and neck, with BJP slightly leading. The Congress is poised for a comeback, focusing on unemployment and agrarian distress. Notably, Bhupinder Singh Hooda and Vinesh Phogat are leading in their respective constituencies.

title: Priest Yati Narsinghanand facing 2 FIRs for hate speech untraceable
description: An FIR has been filed against Alt News co-founder Mohammad Zubair for allegedly inciting protests against Dasna Devi temple priest Yati Narsinghanand. Zubair's posts allegedly led to a demonstration, prompting police to impose prohibitory orders. The charges against Zubair include promoting enmity and defamation. Ten protesters were arrested amid heightened security and tension in Ghaziabad.

title: When Sachin Tendulkar played in the Hong Kong Cricket Sixes
description: Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar's participation in the 1990s Hong Kong Cricket Sixes highlighted the tournament's popularity. After a seven-year hiatus, the event returns this November, with Team India joining the 20th edition, promising an exciting display of quick, high-scoring cricket.

title: Comcast: Data breach affecting 230k customers in ransomware attack
description: Comcast has confirmed a data breach stemming from a ransomware attack on a former debt collection partner, compromising personal information of over 237,000 customers from 2021. The exposed data includes names, addresses, and Social Security numbers. Comcast is notifying affected individuals, offering free identity theft protection for at least 12 months, and advising vigilance against fraud.

title: 'Iron from Eiffel Tower...': Hardik questions 'quality' of Paris Olympic medal
description: Indian hockey midfielder Hardik Singh humorously questioned the quality of his Paris 2024 Olympic bronze medal, doubting its composition. Hardik expressed disappointment during a podcast appearance. He also highlighted the recognition issues faced by athletes in India, sharing an incident where his team was overlooked in favor of a social media personality.

title: ‘Glacier baba’s’ illegal temple near sacred Uttarakhand kund demolished
description: Authorities dismantled an illegal structure built by Baba Chaitanya Akash near Devi Kund in the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve after a strenuous two-day trek. The unauthorized construction sparked local outrage over environmental concerns, prompting a swift response from officials to uphold ecological protections.

title: 'They would drop him': Former India opener's warning for Sanju Samson
description: Sanju Samson, aiming for a permanent spot in the Indian cricket team, opened against Bangladesh in the T20I series under new leadership. Despite a promising start, he was dismissed for 29 runs. Aakash Chopra stressed the need for consistency to avoid being dropped, praising Samson's elegant shot-making but urging him to capitalize on opportunities.

title: UP man jailed for praising Pakistan, making anti-India remarks in video
description: A 23-year-old auto mechanic, Asif Shah, was arrested in Bareilly for making anti-India comments and praising Pakistan in a viral video. Friends of Shah recorded and posted the video online. Complaints by two individuals led to an FIR and Shah's subsequent detention. He has no prior criminal record.

title: Venus in Libra: What does it mean and how does it affect your life?
description: Venus in Libra emphasizes balance, harmony, and partnerships, reflecting the diplomatic and elegant nature of the sign. People with this placement seek equitable relationships, value aesthetics, and favor open communication. They appreciate beauty in surroundings and expect mutual effort and fairness in love and finances.

title: Centre to start selling tomatoes at Rs 65/kg in Delhi as prices surge
description: The Centre has begun selling tomatoes at Rs 65 per kg in 50 locations across New Delhi to address a price surge ahead of the festive season, driven by monsoon rains and humidity affecting production in major states. This intervention might soon extend to other cities.

title: Watch: Axar reveals wife Meha's pregnancy with a heartwarming video
description: Indian cricketer Axar Patel announced his wife Meha's pregnancy through an Instagram video, garnering many congratulatory messages. The couple, who married in January 2023, joyfully prepares for their first child. Axar has been rested from the T20I series against Bangladesh, allowing him to spend time with his family.

title: Boeing 737s could be using rudder part that may pose safety risk: DGCA
description: The DGCA has recommended precautionary measures for Boeing 737 aircraft with Collins Aerospace rudders due to potential risks of rudder jamming, highlighted by a US investigation. Indian carriers like Air India Express, Akasa, and SpiceJet will halt low visibility landings and provide specialized rudder control training for pilots. Boeing is working on additional guidance for the issue.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya's heartwarming moment with son Agastya
description: Indian cricketer Hardik Pandya dedicates time to his son Agastya after separating from Natasa Stankovic, sharing heartwarming moments on social media. Currently part of India's T20I squad against Bangladesh, Pandya's impressive performance includes an unbeaten 39-run knock that led India to victory in the first match.

title: Shakib Al Hasan's farewell Test in Bangladesh could become reality
description: Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh's cricket icon, might fulfill his wish to play his farewell Test at home as top officials show support. Youth and Sports advisor Asif Mahmud Shojib Bhuyain endorsed this, promising top-notch security for Shakib. Despite his political challenges, the Bangladesh Cricket Board aims to include him in the Test series against South Africa.

title: Nearly 50 companies offer 13k internship opportunities under govt scheme
description: Close to 50 companies, including major players like TCS, Tech Mahindra, and L&T, have offered over 13,000 internships through the PM Internship scheme portal. Around 200 companies have registered so far, aiming to bridge the skills gap by targeting over 1.2 lakh internships this financial year. Opportunities span various sectors, and internships are focused on unemployed youth aged 21-24.

title: Horoscope Today, October 8, 2024: Read your today's astrological predictions
description: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for October 8, 2024. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: Ayushman soon to cover Alzheimer's, dementia and other old-age ailments
description: The government is planning to expand the Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY) to cover treatments for Alzheimer's, dementia, heart failure, and other illnesses affecting seniors. This move aims to benefit around six crore individuals aged 70 and above, providing them with timely and affordable healthcare under specialized packages.

title: India set to discuss surge in silver imports with UAE
description: India will address concerns about increased silver imports from the UAE during a joint meeting next week. Both countries are also working on inter-linking national payment platforms and setting up a $2 billion food corridor. UAE investments in India could touch $100 billion across various sectors, including infrastructure and manufacturing.

title: PM Modi accepts Muizzu invite to visit Maldives next year
description: India and the Maldives have strengthened ties with a currency swap pact of USD 400 million and Rs 3000 crore, along with five other agreements. Key initiatives include the development of Hanimaadhoo International Airport and support for the Maldivian coast guard. Both nations commit to economic resilience and regional stability.

title: India's G20 sherpa pitches for 750GW of clean energy by 2030
description: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant highlights that while there is no lack of global funds, there is a need to increase India's clean energy capacity to 750GW by 2030. He advocates for leveraging international financial institutions to attract private finance and calls for strong agreements between the Centre, states, and RBI.

title: Himachal Cong govt borrowed Rs 27,000 cr in 18 mnths: Anurag Thakur
description: In the past 18 months, the Congress government in Himachal Pradesh has accrued over Rs 27,000 crore in loans, former Union minister Anurag Thakur revealed. Despite increased borrowing, developmental work remains underfunded, and roads, including those in CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu's constituency, are in poor condition.

title: Amazon executive to be new Nestle India head
description: Nestle India’s MD Suresh Narayanan is set to retire in July 2025, with Manish Tiwary from Amazon nominated as his successor. Tiwary brings extensive experience from Amazon and Unilever, poised to bolster Nestle's digital strategies, ecommerce operations, and customer engagement in a tech-savvy market.

title: Jammu and Kashmir air thick with 'conspiracies' & controversies
description: Jammu and Kashmir teeters on the edge as election results await, following a decade-long gap and the revocation of its special status. Key players like NC, Congress, and BJP, alongside smaller parties and independents, stir controversies. Accusations and uncertainties plague the political landscape, making alliances and majority calculations intensely unpredictable.

title: 'Cash-strapped' Congress spent Rs 585 crore on 2024 LS, state polls
85% of Chhattisgarh Naxals killed in 10 years: Amit Shah
description: Home minister Amit Shah has announced the elimination of 85% of Left-wing extremists in Chhattisgarh over the past decade, along with top CPI (Maoist) leaders nationwide. By March 2026, Shah aims to end Left-wing extremism and promote development in affected areas, emphasizing road, telecom, and financial connectivity for locals.

title: Hero Motors withdraws documents for Rs 900cr IPO
description: Hero Motors has retracted its IPO plan worth Rs 900 crore, as indicated in an update with Sebi. The proposed IPO included a fresh issue to raise Rs 500 crore and an OFS worth Rs 400 crore by promoters. Proceeds were intended for debt payment and facility expansion.

title: Amid chaos in Manipur, 168 offered jobs under central skilling scheme
description: Amid the Manipur crisis, 168 individuals have secured jobs after completing training under the 'Hunar Se Rozgar' scheme. Among them are 78 internally displaced persons (IDPs) including 15 women trained in fragrance & wellness at Delhi University. CM N Biren Singh announced incentives to encourage small-scale perfumery production, promoting entrepreneurship among young women in Manipur.

title: Auto retail sales skid 9% in Sept on sluggish demand
description: Auto retail sales in India saw a 9% decline in September due to high passenger vehicle inventory and weak demand. Passenger vehicle sales dropped 19%, while two-wheeler registrations fell by 8%. Commercial vehicle registrations declined 10%, though tractor sales saw a 15% increase despite overall sluggish market conditions.

title: Sanjay Roy raped and murdered RG Kar doctor: CBI chargesheet
description: CBI filed a chargesheet naming Sanjay Roy, a Kolkata Police volunteer, as the sole accused in the August 9 rape-murder of a doctor at RG Kar hospital. Arrested within 24 hours, Roy faces charges under sections punishable by death, with a supplementary chargesheet likely.

title: PM Modi completes 23 years in public office, says a lot still to be done
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking 23 years in elected office since becoming Gujarat CM, pledges continued commitment to India's development. He highlights achievements like poverty alleviation and economic growth, and vows to work tirelessly until a "developed India" is achieved. Senior BJP leaders praise his journey, calling it an inspiration for the nation.

title: AI, robotics to power big CISCE reforms
description: CISCE will implement significant reforms in its education system from 2025-26, introducing AI, robotics, and holistic progress cards for Classes XI-XII. Competency-based questions in Board exams will increase gradually from 25% to 50% by 2027, aligned with the National Education Policy 2020.

title: India Inc must create more jobs: Manasi Kirloskar
description: CISCE will introduce robotics and AI for Classes XI and XII from 2025-26, integrating these subjects at the elementary level with computer science. The holistic progress card, competency-based questions, and digital assessments will align with the National Education Policy 2020. These changes aim to foster creativity, innovation, and critical thinking across over 30 lakh students.

title: Draft sent for printing, Uttarakhand set to bring in UCC on Nov 9
description: The nine-member panel in Dehradun has completed drafting the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) rules and regulations, with the report now heading for printing. The UCC likely will be implemented in Uttarakhand on November 9. A notable feature is enabling online registrations for marriage, wills, and other certificates.

title: NextGen of Maharashtra dynasties pads up for upcoming elections
description: Maharashtra's assembly polls signal a generational shift as political scions like Kunal Raut, Salil Deshmukh, and Jay Pawar, among others, prepare to debut. Various prominent families across Congress, NCP, and BJP are setting up fresh leadership to uphold their political legacies.

title: HIV prevention therapy likely to become cheaper but accessibility concerns remain
description: Gilead Sciences collaborates with Indian companies to produce affordable generic versions of its HIV prevention therapy, lenacapavir, potentially dropping prices from $40,000 to $200-$300 annually in India. Despite the promise, experts criticize the restrictive voluntary license, which may hinder API supply and delay significant price cuts in developing countries.

title: Tejashwi took away ACs, taps from bungalow: NDA
description: Senior BJP and JD(U) leaders in Bihar have accused ex-deputy CM Tejashwi Prasad Yadav of taking furniture and appliances while vacating his official bungalow. Union minister Giriraj Singh called for an inquiry, while RJD dismissed the claims as politically motivated.

title: With only 0.1% Ganja use, Tamil Nadu sets benchmark for anti-drug efforts
description: Tamil Nadu police claim zero cultivation of Ganja, with minimal use of substances like Ganja, opioids, and sedatives compared to national averages. The state has established NCORD committees and 'Mission Management Unit' to combat drug availability, conduct financial investigations, and promote Anti-Drug Clubs in educational institutions.

title: Chennai police rope in actor Yogi Babu for video on cyber crimes
description: Chennai city police have launched an awareness video featuring actor Yogi Babu to educate the public about various scams such as courier and Skype scams. The video advises immediate disconnection of suspicious calls and contacting the cybercrime helpline '1930'. Scammers often impersonate officials and target senior citizens.

title: Bigg Boss 18 promo: Karan Veer Mehra teases Shrutika Raaj as she misses her husband; says, “Arjun abhi Bangkok jaa raha hoga”
description: In a recent Bigg Boss 18 promo, Karan Veer Mehra playfully teases Shrutika Raaj, who is feeling emotional and missing her husband, Arjun. This humorous moment highlights the developing friendships and lighter interactions between the contestants amidst the show's usual intense atmosphere.

title: TVS Radeon 110's new base model launched, Priced at Rs 59,880: What's new
description: TVS Motor Company has launched a budget-friendly variant of the Radeon 110 priced at Rs 59,880. It remains the same in design and technology but now features an all-black paint job. Powered by a 109.7cc engine, it offers practical features like a colour LCD display and a USB charging port, competing with Hero Splendor Plus and Bajaj Platina.

title: Faridabad Assembly Election Result 2024: BJP's Vipul Goel leads with over 8000 votes
description: Vipul Goel of the BJP leads in Faridabad Assembly with a significant 8,126-vote margin over Lakhan Kumar Singla of the INC. The constituency has recorded a 53% voter turnout. INLD's Narender Pal Singh Baghel falls far behind with only 462 votes.

title: 1 dead, 11 injured as Vijayawada lawyers’ tour bus collides with truck in Rajasthan
description: In Ajmer, Rajasthan, a bus carrying Vijayawada Bar Association lawyers collided with a parked truck, killing Jyotsna, wife of senior lawyer Sunkara Rajendra Prasad, and injuring 11. Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu expressed sorrow and praised her efforts in women's and students' empowerment.

title: 'NC-Congress alliance will cross magic figure of 50': Congress leader Ghulam Mir on assembly polls result day
description: Ghulam Ahmad Mir said, "As per ground reporting after polling, we knew it was going to be a landslide victory for us, the same is the situation in Jammu and Kashmir. There is a strong anti-incumbency wave against BJP, that's why we made a viable alliance. And as per the early trends today, we believe that the alliance will cross its magic figure of 50."

title: Google Docs gets Document Tabs' for enhanced organisation: Here’s what it means for users
description: Google Docs has introduced document tabs, a new feature that helps users organise and navigate through long documents by creating multiple sections, each with its own title and ID. This feature allows for enhanced document management and easier collaboration, and is available to all Google Workspace subscribers and personal account holders.

title: Shahid Kapoor shows his love for 'ghar ka khana' and it's too relatable to miss! - PIC inside
description: In his Instagram story, Shahid Kapoor looks chic in a casual white t-shirt, recording himself as he digs into his meal. His expression is one of pure delight as he winks and savours the flavors of home-cooked food. Accompanying the video, he wrote, “Ghar ka Khaana late aana lekin dil khush ho Jana. Yummm” (When the food from home comes late but makes you happy).

title: "We do it every day in practice”: Kansas City Chiefs Head Coach Andy Reid Confirms Travis Kelce’s 3rd And 22 Lateral Play Was Planned
description: During a game against the New Orleans Saints, Patrick Mahomes executed a planned lateral to Travis Kelce, who then passed to Samaje Perine. Coach Andy Reid confirmed the strategy. The Chiefs, dealing with key injuries, executed the play, leading to a field goal.

title: Maldives President Mohammad Muizzu and first lady visit Taj Mahal
description: Maldives President Mohammad Muizzu and first lady Sajidha Mohamed visited the Taj Mahal, resulting in a two-hour closure for the public. Muizzu, on a four-day visit to India, is set to meet with key Indian officials to discuss bilateral and international issues. He also invited PM Modi to visit Maldives next year, which Modi accepted.

title: Jupiter Retrograde begins October 9, 2024: Time for reflection and inner growth
description: From October 9, Jupiter retrograde in Gemini encourages introspection until February 4, 2025. This phase shifts focus from external exploration to inner reflection, urging all zodiac signs to reassess beliefs, values, and long-term goals for personal growth and deeper understanding.

title: Pandal hopping and lots of fun mark Times Chhotoder Sharad Shrestha 2024
description: Pandal hopping and lots of fun mark Times Chhotoder Sharad Shrestha 2024

title: Fact Check: Can Marburg virus infection cause bleeding eyes?
description: Marburg disease is spreading rapidly in Rwanda, causing 11 fatalities so far. The virus, related to the Ebola virus, induces severe symptoms including bleeding from various body parts. Diagnosis requires specific tests. Infected individuals exhibit 'ghost-like' features with high fever and severe pain. The virus can persist in immune-privileged sites even after recovery.

title: "Don’t make any jokes": Joe Buck Admits Marriage Jokes About Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Are Strictly Off the Table
description: Taylor Swift's appearance at the Chiefs-Saints game continued to stir fan excitement as her relationship with Chiefs' Travis Kelce remains under public scrutiny. During the game, ESPN commentators humorously addressed speculation about their marital status, highlighting the ongoing interest despite no engagement announcements. The playful moment illustrates widespread fascination with the couple’s relationship.

title: Dhanush and Aishwarya fail to appear before the court; Are they planning to reconcile?
description: Actor Dhanush and Aishwarya, daughter of Rajinikanth, are pursuing a mutual divorce, with their next court hearing scheduled for October 19. The couple, who married in 2004 and have two sons, announced their separation in 2022 after facing relationship challenges.

title: Who is Suhail Hussein Husseini? Hezbollah HQ's commander killed by Israel
description: Israel announced on Monday that it had conducted an airstrike killing Suhail Hussein Husseini, Hezbollah's headquarters commander. He played a crucial role in managing logistics, budget, and weapons transfers between Iran and Hezbollah, as well as overseeing the group’s military operations and precision-guided missile development.

title: Seth Rollins leaves the ring with apparent frustration with Intercontinental Champion Jey Uso
description: Seth Rollins interrupts CM Punk during a promo on Monday Night Raw, promising to retire Punk eventually. Rollins gets frustrated by Jey Uso's entrance while he was still addressing the audience. Meanwhile, Rollins also challenges Bronson Reed, indicating readiness for their upcoming confrontation.

title: 'Pookie Baba' Aniruddhacharya's Bigg Boss 18 appearance triggers meme fest; netizens say ‘Baba ji khud maya main doob gaye’
description: Bigg Boss Season 18's premiere featured spiritual leader Aniruddhacharya, also known as 'Pookie Baba,' surprising viewers with his appearance despite his past criticisms of the show. He presented host Salman Khan with a Bhagavad Gita, sparking mixed social media reactions. Aniruddhacharya clarified his role was a brief guest visit, focusing on spreading his spiritual message.

title: Kerala lottery results:  Sthree Sakthi SS- 436 winners for 08 October  2024; first prize Rs. 75 lakhs, second prize Rs 10 lakhs and third prize Rs. 5000
description: The Kerala state-run lottery system is set to reveal the results of its Sthree Sakthi SS-436 draw on 08 October, featuring a top prize of Rs. 75 lakhs. Players can check results online or through live streams. The article also details how to claim winnings and lists the necessary documents for verification.

title: Babar Azam's terrible run in Test cricket continues: When was the last time he hit a fifty?
description: Pakistan had a strong start in the first Test against England, with Abdullah Shafique and Shan Masood scoring centuries. Despite favourable batting conditions, Babar Azam's struggles continued, getting out for just 30 runs, marking nearly two years without a fifty in Test cricket. In sharp contrast, current skipper Shan Masood slammed a century.

title: IAF jawan faints during Air Force anniversary event in Chennai, days after Air Show deaths
description: An Indian Air Force jawan collapsed during IAF's 92nd anniversary celebration at Tambaram Air Force Station in Chennai. This incident follows a recent air show tragedy at Marina Beach where five attendees died due to extreme heat. Critics have blamed poor administrative planning for these incidents.

title: Bhavish Aggarwal’s Ola Electric gets show cause notice over consumer complaints
description: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal's online spat with comedian Kunal Kamra coincides with Ola Electric facing a show-cause notice from the Central Consumer Protection Authority. The notice stems from over 10,000 customer complaints regarding service delays, manufacturing defects, and other issues. Ola Electric's shares have seen significant drops, with Aggarwal promising improvements.

title: Shraddha Kapoor’s Stree 2 requires just Rs 5 Crore to cross Rs 600 crore mark
description: Shraddha Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao's Stree 2 is close to reaching the Rs 600 crore milestone. The film has grossed Rs 595 crore so far but is seeing a decline in daily collections. With new releases on the way and its release on OTT, it remains to be seen if it will reach the mark.

title: Bigg Boss Telugu fame Subhashree Rayaguru escapes unhurt in a road accident
description: Subhashree Rayaguru, known for her appearance on Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7, narrowly escaped a serious accident on October 7, 2024. While traveling near Nagarjuna Sagar in Hyderabad, her car was hit by a motorcycle ridden by two intoxicated men. Thankfully, both parties only sustained minor injuries, with helmets playing a crucial role in preventing further harm. The accident caused significant damage to the front of Subhashree's vehicle.

title: 'Longstanding problem': Kamala Harris deflects immigration criticism, MAGA calls it a 'meltdown'
description: Vice President Harris defends her immigration stance on CBS' 60 Minutes, attributing delayed reforms to congressional opposition. Despite criticisms, she highlights reductions in border crossings and fentanyl trafficking, calling for continued legislative efforts to address the issue comprehensively.

title: 3 killed after an Air Evacuation helicopter crashes in Owen County
description: An Air Evac Lifeteam helicopter crashed in Owen County, Kentucky, killing all three crew members on board. The crash occurred while the helicopter was en route to pick up a patient. Authorities have identified the victims and are investigating the incident. Power outages were reported in the area following the crash.

title: Haryana election results: Congress says 'early trends don't matter' in neck and neck battle with BJP
description: Early trends in Haryana and Jammu Kashmir elections show promising results for Congress. Pawan Khera expresses optimism about securing a full majority, crediting initiatives like Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra and Nyay Yatra. Celebrations erupted at Congress office, while TS Tony from Jammu highlighted public frustration with BJP's governance issues.

title: Suzie Bates thinks New Zealand can beat Australia by mirroring their performance against India
description: Ahead of an all-important clash against Australia in the ongoing ICC T20 Women's World Cup on Tuesday, New Zealand Women opener Suzie Bates said that they have competed "pretty well" in recent times against the defending champions.

title: Tired of the Taylor Swift Cam? Bill Belichick, Who Always Admired Taylor Swift, Voices His Annoyance on Chiefs-Saints 'ManningCast'
description: Bill Belichick showed irritation over the focus on Taylor Swift during ESPN's 'ManningCast' of a Kansas City Chiefs game. Cameras frequently centered on Swift, who was supporting Travis Kelce. Despite his initial frustration, Belichick was previously seen wearing a Taylor Swift sweatshirt and has expressed admiration for her performances.

title: What can inflammation do to body and herbs that can reduce it
description: Inflammation acts as a defense mechanism but chronic inflammation can harm the body, causing diseases like heart disease, diabetes, and cancer. Causes include poor diet, lack of exercise, and stress.Reducing inflammation naturally requires patience and consistency, but the benefits are long-lasting—improving not just your physical health but your mental well-being too.

title: HC asks Telangana to take back land given to IT firms
description: Telangana high court has ordered the state government to reclaim land from multiple companies, including Indu Techzone and Brahmani Infratech, for not establishing the promised projects. The companies were allotted 250 acres each but failed to comply with terms. The decision follows a 2007 petition by a non-profit challenging the land allotment process.

title: Thane dairy shop gutted in fire, no casualties
description: A fire erupted at a dairy products shop on Sabegaon Road in Thane, Maharashtra, early Tuesday morning. No casualties were reported, though the shop was completely gutted. Firefighters controlled the blaze within an hour and conducted cooling operations. An investigation into the fire's cause is underway.

title: The Chiefs Remains Undefeated As They Improved to 5-0 Victory Over the New Orleans Saints on Monday Night Football
description: The Kansas City Chiefs improved to 5-0 after defeating the New Orleans Saints 26-13, despite dealing with key injuries. Patrick Mahomes led the charge with 28-of-39 yards, while the Saints' offensive struggles and Derek Carr's injury hindered their comeback efforts.

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy seeks Rs 46k crore from Centre for Musi, Metro & sewage plan
description: Hyderabad's chief minister Revanth Reddy requested nearly Rs 46,000 crore from the Centre for key projects, including Rs 24,269 crore for Metro Rail phase-2 and Rs 17,212 crore for a comprehensive sewerage plan. Additionally, Rs 4,000 crore was sought for the Musi river cleaning project. Reddy highlighted these infrastructure needs in a meeting with Union minister Manohar Lal Khattar.

title: India hands over first consignment of emergency relief materials to flood-hit Nepal
description: The Indian Embassy in Kathmandu delivered 4.2 tonnes of emergency relief materials, including sleeping bags, blankets, and tarpaulin sheets, to flood-affected Nepalese families. This aid follows severe floods and landslides that killed over 240 people. The consignment, including hygiene items and medicines, was handed over by Second Secretary Narayan Singh to local authorities in Banke.

title: Exclusive! Pooja Hegde on Navratri: Navratri is celebrating the different shades of Devi in us
description: Pooja Hegde shares her fond Navratri memories, from childhood Dandiya and Garba nights to family traditions. Despite busy schedules, she prioritizes celebrating with her family. Pooja reflects on Navratri's significance, symbolizing womanhood and good karma, and strives to embody these values year-round, believing "Karma comes back manifold."

title: 'ICC knows the price of everything...': David Lloyd blasts ICC for England cricket team's schedule
description: David Lloyd criticised the ICC for overloading the England cricket team with a packed schedule, leaving no room for fans to plan their attendance. He also highlighted the lack of warm-up games, which hampers teams' preparations ahead of important series and tournaments.

Candidates can apply via the official MCC website, with choice locking available from 4 PM to 11:55 PM today. Seat allotment will be processed between October 9-10, and results will be announced on October 11, 2024. Reporting to institutes will occur from October 12-18, 2024.

title: Navratri as Spiritual Detox: 9 days to cleanse your mind, body and soul
description: Navaratri, derived from Sanskrit, signifies a nine-night festival dedicated to goddess Durga. It emphasizes holistic detoxification through fasting, mindfulness, and devotion. Devotees consume easy-to-digest foods, practice meditation, and focus on spiritual texts. These activities cleanse the body, mind, and emotions, fostering overall well-being and preparing for renewed energy in life.

I will be Haryana’s CM if...: BJP's Anil Vij
description: Amid the neck and neck fight in Haryana, Anil Vij, BJP candidate from Ambala Cantt Assembly seat on Tuesday said that if the high command wants he will become the Chief Minister. "BJP is leading in the elections and they (Congress) are celebrating because many people in the Congress party want Bhupinder Singh Hooda to lose the elections...I will accept the mandate of the public. If the high command wants, I will be the Chief Minister."The ruling BJP and the Congress were engaged in a sea-saw battle in Haryana on Tuesday as the Election Commission website showed the saffron party was just ahead of the Congress after about two hours of counting of votes on Tuesday.Catch live action here According to EC trends available at 10 am, the BJP was leading in 43 seats and the Congress on 34, the first time the ruling party overtook the Congress after counting began at 8 am.  The counting of votes for all the 90 assembly seats began at 93 centres in 22 districts of the state amid tight security.  While the BJP is looking to retain power for a third consecutive term, the Congress is eyeing a comeback in Haryana after 10 years. According to the latest EC trends, INLD and Independents were ahead on one seat each. Earlier trends on the ECI website showed the Congress was leading on 18 seats while the BJP was ahead on 14 seats.

title: Stocks to buy or sell today: Infosys, Tata Motors among top 7 trading ideas
description: The Indian market is likely to bounce back and move higher on Tuesday, tracking positive global cues.The Nifty futures closed with a loss of 0.67%, at 25,005 on Monday.On the options front, the maximum Call OI is placed at the 27,000 and 26,000 strikes, while the maximum Put OI is at the 24,000 and 24,500 strikes.Call writing is seen at the 25,000 and 24,900 strikes, while Put writing is observed at the 24,700 and 24,100 strikes.“Options data suggests a broader trading range between 24,400 and 25,400 zones, with an immediate range between 24,500 and 25,200 levels,” said Chandan Taparia, Analyst-Derivatives at Motilal Oswal Financial Services Limited.“Nifty formed a bearish candle on the daily chart on Monday and has been making lower highs and lower lows for the past five sessions,” he added.“Until Nifty holds below 24,950, weakness could extend towards 24,650, then 24,500 zones, while hurdles are placed at 24,950, then 25,150 zones,” Taparia recommended.We have collated a list of stocks from the F&O basket along with cash market from various experts for traders who have a short-term trading horizon:Expert: Ajit Mishra, SVP - Technical Research, Religare Broking Ltd told ETBureauInfosys: Buy | Target: Rs 2,050 | Stop Loss: Rs 1,875Divi’s Laboratories: Buy | Target: Rs 5,750 | Stop Loss: Rs 5,200Coal India: Sell | Target: Rs 445 | Stop Loss: Rs 500Tata Motors: Sell | Target: Rs 870 | Stop Loss: Rs 965Expert: Kunal Bothra, Market Expert told ETNowBharti Airtel: Buy | Target: Rs 1,688 | Stop Loss: Rs 1,638ITC: Buy | Target: Rs 530 | Stop Loss: Rs 505Balkrishna Industries: Sell | Target: Rs 2,720 | Stop Loss: Rs 2,860(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views, and opinions given by experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)

title: Big movers on D-Street: What should investors do with Macrotech Developers, Naukri and Titan?
description: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty extended their losing streak for the sixth straight session and settled sharply lower on Monday dragged down by heavy selling in bellwether stocks amid mixed global trends.Stocks that were in focus include names like Macrotech Developers, which gained 1.3%, Naukri, which declined 2.4%, and Titan, whose shares were down 2.6% on Monday.Here's what Ameya Ranadive CMT CFTe, Sr Technical Analyst at StoxBox, recommends investors should do with these stocks when the market resumes trading today.Macrotech DevelopersMacrotech Developers is currently trading at Rs 1,190, facing downward pressure as it struggles to hold its 20, 50, and 100-day exponential moving averages (EMAs). However, the stock is taking support at the 200-day EMA, a key indicator of long-term trend strength.The most critical support level lies between Rs 1,150 and Rs 1,090, and with the Relative Strength Index (RSI) bouncing from oversold territory at 38, this presents an appealing risk-reward scenario. If the stock sustains above the Rs 1,155 mark, a potential rebound could take it towards targets of Rs 1,415 to Rs 1,450.Despite recent weakness, the stock remains in a position where any technical bounce could offer a good opportunity for short-term traders and investors. However, caution is warranted if LODHA breaks below the crucial support at Rs 1,150, it could signal further downside.Investors are advised to watch the stock closely for signs of a reversal at these levelsNaukriNaukri (Info Edge) is currently trading at Rs 7,960, continuing its robust performance despite market volatility. Over the past year, the stock has delivered over 140% returns from its 2023 lows, making it a standout performer.Even as the broader market faces profit-booking pressure, Naukri has consistently hit new all-time highs, underscoring its strength. The stock is trading comfortably above its 20, 50, 100, and 200-day EMAs, which points to a healthy uptrend. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is at a steady 55, and the Average Directional Index (ADX) reads 27, indicating that bullish momentum is intact.Given its solid technical structure, Naukri is an ideal buy-on-dips candidate. Investors can expect further gains, with potential upside targets ranging from Rs 8,250 to Rs 8,500. For those seeking long-term growth, the stock's resilience in challenging market conditions presents a compelling opportunity. Any pullbacks toward key support levels could be used as entry points for further accumulation.TitanTitan is currently trading at Rs 3,586, at a crucial support zone between Rs 3,550 and Rs 3,500, an area that previously acted as resistance. This support zone, along with the 100 and 200-day EMAs, suggests that the stock is at a key inflection point.The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is at 39, indicating that the stock is nearing oversold territory, which could trigger a technical rebound. Given the stock's ability to hold these critical support levels, Titan offers a favorable risk-reward opportunity for traders and investors.A bounce from this support zone could propel the stock towards targets of Rs 3,900 to Rs 4,000, offering an upside potential of 9-12%. Titan has shown strength in maintaining long-term trend support, and this level could attract buying interest for those looking for a short-term gain. Investors are advised to watch for confirmation of the rebound before entering new positions, as a failure to hold support could lead to further downside.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)

title: Watch: How Israel strike on Beirut killed Hezbollah media chief Mohammed Afif

title: School closure due to pollution: Check list of affected states

Punjab and Uttar Pradesh are monitoring the situation closely, considering similar measures to protect students' health.

title: Fans rush to Allu Arjun, Rashmika in Patna; Police resort to lathi charge

Police had to intervene with a "mild" lathi charge as the crowd grew unruly. Despite the commotion, the trailer created a buzz online, offering an action-packed glimpse into the sequel's storyline, featuring Pushpa’s swag and fiery confrontations.

title: Maharashtra elections: List of upcoming dry days in Mumbai, other cities

To ensure a peaceful election process, alcohol sales will be restricted on November 18, 19, 20, and 23. The BMC has also declared November 20 a public holiday to encourage voter participation.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex, Nifty50 open flat in trade
description: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Monday. While BSE Sensex was near 77,600, Nifty50 was below 23,550.

title: Biden lets Ukraine hit deep inside Russia with US arms

title: GRAP 4 in Delhi: Here's how current air quality in Delhi can impact health
description: Delhi's air quality plummets to its worst this season, triggering GRAP 4 restrictions.  With a severe AQI of 484, the city faces bans on truck entry, construction activities, and reduced office capacities.  These measures aim to combat the hazardous air pollution posing serious health risks to all residents, particularly children and the elderly.

title: 'Virat Kohli annoyed me that night'

Despite their attempts, Kohli went on to score four centuries on the tour, including a magnificent 169 in Melbourne after a dropped catch fueled his determination.

title: No sunrise in this US town in Alaska for 64 days! Here's why

title: Pollution risk: 6 ways to monitor your heart health during smog season

FDI foul play? ED probes Amazon and Flipkart
description: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has turned to investigating whether arrangements between Amazon and Flipkart, and their vendors, violated foreign direct investment (FDI) norms, said people aware of the matter. The investigation had earlier focused on the sellers.The aim is to find out if the ecommerce companies were exercising control over vendors. Under the rules, they can only act as platforms.ED is investigating alleged violations under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (Fema) that are ordinarily civil offences entailing monetary penalties. Earlier this month, the agency conducted nationwide searches at 19 sites related to large sellers on Amazon and Flipkart in New Delhi, Bengaluru and Hyderabad.“The sellers covered during the searches were summoned and have been questioned to explain certain transactions and arrangements. Documents are being studied thoroughly,” said an official with knowledge of the matter. “The main focus is to ascertain whether Amazon and Flipkart operated through a preferred set of sellers, which were invariably controlled by them but disguised as independent vendors, thus violating FDI norms.”115392764“Once all search-related documents are studied and people linked to them are questioned, key managerial personnel—who handle FDI of the company—will be asked to join the probe,” said the official cited above.Actionable materialWhile the sellers were covered in the first leg, the next one will be concentrated on the ecommerce giants, those in the know said. The issue dates from 2019, said a person linked to one of the companies.Amazon India and Flipkart did not respond to ET’s queries. The central probe agency hasn’t summoned them.The issue has been under investigation for the past few years, said the people cited. However, fresh searches were conducted earlier this month after the agency found certain actionable material, according to them.“The issue has been active and, in the past, the companies were asked to join the investigation (and) they had explained their stand,” another person familiar with the probe told ET. “However, there was fresh material, which led to the recent searches.”ED wants to discover whether the platforms played a role in influencing prices and if the sellers breached the 25% sales limit. “ED has collected enough material to ask the companies to explain their side,” one of the persons said.Executives denied any wrongdoing and repeated to ET that they had explained their stand to the authorities before. “FDI norms are very stringent and now, with most of the transactions having a digital footprint, it is impossible to violate them,” said one of them.Any violation will bring scrutiny by multiple law enforcement agencies, something that companies are averse to, given the reputational risk, said another person, adding that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is the FDI gatekeeper, so the scrutiny is rigorous.“Both companies were summoned in the past,” said the executive. “The same set of queries (have been) made by CCI (the Competition Commission of India) and ED, and the companies have explained their stand methodically and meticulously.”India’s FDI rules prohibit ecommerce companies with foreign investment from operating on an inventory-based model. In December 2018, the Centre notified a new set of rules for ecommerce companies, disallowing them from directly or indirectly holding any stake in sellers or having any sway over them. The rules also mandated that no one seller should contribute to more than 25% of the sales of a single platform. Following the tightening of the norms, the two companies have either shut or divested stakes in major sellers listed on their platforms.ET reported in April that Clicktech, a major seller on Amazon India, was acquiring peer Appario Retail as a part of the ecommerce firm’s plan to divest stakes in sellers on its platform. Appario, the largest seller on Amazon India following the closure of Cloudtail, moved a significant volume of orders for the local arm of the US-based etailer. The sale of the stake to Clicktech was the second time Amazon divested its stake from a seller to comply with India’s ecommerce norms.Separately, the marketplaces’ alleged preferences for a small number of large sellers has also been investigated by CCI to ascertain whether they have been providing a level-playing field to all. “The ED probe, however, is different from the CCI action,” said one of the people cited. “It is based on complaints received by ED over alleged violations of foreign investment rules.”

title: CGD firms MGL, IGL shares nosedive 18% on APM gas allocation cuts
description: Shares of Mahanagar Gas and Indraprastha Gas fell up to 18% on Monday after the government cut the Administered Price Mechanism (APM) allocation to city gas distribution firms by 20% for the second consecutive month. Mahanagar Gas shares dropped to Rs 1,075, while Indraprastha Gas shares slid to Rs 324.8.The brokerage slashed its target price for MGL by 35% to Rs 1,164 and for IGL by 31% to Rs 373, reflecting downward revisions in EBITDA estimates, concerns about slower volume growth, and expectations of narrower profit margins in the coming years.For IGL, EBITDA per standard cubic meter (scm) has been slashed by 26.4% for FY25, with the long-term EBITDA average revised down from Rs 8.1/scm to Rs 6.5/scm. MGL faces similar challenges, with its long-term average EBITDA/scm reduced to Rs 10.42, reflecting a 16% decline.Also Read: HAL shares rally 4% after Q2 PAT jumps 22% YoY to Rs 1,510 crore The sudden and successive cuts in APM gas allocation have disrupted the CGD sector, which had gradually adapted to previous allocation reductions, bringing it from 94% to under 70%. However, the accelerated pace of these cuts has caught companies off guard, forcing them to rely more heavily on expensive LNG to meet demand.The additional costs are expected to lead to significant CNG price hikes, which could erode consumer affordability and further compress margins. Nirmal Bang estimates that EBITDA growth for both companies will remain under pressure through FY27, with limited scope for operational recovery in the near term.While the government has shown support for CNG as a cleaner fuel alternative, policy actions have been somewhat inconsistent. The brokerage suggests that relief measures, such as excise duty cuts, could partially offset the financial burden. A reduction of 5-6% in excise duties could lower CNG prices by Rs 3-4 per kilogram, providing some relief to consumers and aiding volume recovery. However, the lack of a clear long-term policy framework continues to weigh heavily on investor sentiment.Also Read: Zinka Logistics IPO Day 3: GMP, price band, subscription, key dates and reviewFinancial forecasts for the companies suggest a challenging outlook. For FY25, IGL’s revenue is projected to grow by 9%, but PAT is expected to decline by 26%, with EBITDA margins revised down to 11%. MGL is likely to see a 7.5% increase in revenue, but PAT is forecasted to drop by 21%, with EBITDA margins reduced to 22% from the earlier estimate of 24%.The broader CGD sector is facing rising costs, regulatory uncertainties, and competitive pressures. While positive developments, such as price adjustments or tax reliefs, could prompt short-term rallies, the overall outlook remains uncertain. Investors are likely to remain cautious until the sector demonstrates clear signs of operational recovery and policy stability.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of The Economic Times)

title: HAL shares rally 4% after Q2 PAT jumps 22% YoY to Rs 1,510 crore
description: Shares of PSU company Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) today surged 4% to an intraday high of Rs 4,246 on the BSE today after the company on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 1,510 crore for the quarter that ended September 30, 2024, rising 22% over Rs 1,237 crore reported in the year-ago period.The revenue from operations stood at Rs 5,976 crore, gaining 6% over Rs 5,636 crore posted by the company in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.On a sequential basis, the profit after tax (PAT) was 5% higher over Rs 1,437 crore reported by the state-run defense company in Q1FY25. Meanwhile, revenue was up 37% on a quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) basis as against Rs 4,34,750 reported in the April-June quarter of FY25.Post the company’s Q2 update, domestic brokerage firm ICICI Securities gave a target price of Rs 5,170 on the stock while maintaining its ‘add’ rating on the same.“Taking cognisance of the delay in engines, impacting revenue from Tejas Mk-1A, wehave lowered our FY25/26E EBITDA by 16%/4%, respectively. Furthermore, owing tothe uncertainty surrounding earnings, we are raising the discount rate (WACC) by100bps to 11% in our DCF model,” said the domestic brokerage firm in its report.Delay in execution of existing 83 Tejas Mk-1A orders and in the receipt of further orders for which AoN has been executed along with a margin decline owing to higher raw material prices have been stated as the key risks for the company.Shares of HAL have been making lower tops and lower bottoms on its daily chart, having taken a fall after hitting an all-time high of Rs 5,674.75 in July this year.Since then, the stock has corrected by almost 30% since then and by 8.55% in the last one month.Also read: Last day to buy MRF shares for dividend eligibility as stock trades ex-dividend tomorrowOn the stock’s daily chart, the shares price recently encountered a resistance near the Ichimoku cloud, which led to a correction of around 6-7% in just a week’s time. Now, the stock is below all its significant short, medium and long term EMAs.“A decisive close below Rs 4,100 could intensify the downside pressure, potentially driving the stock toward the Rs 3,700- Rs 3,850 range. On the upside, any rebound may face significant resistance in the Rs 4,400-4,650 zone, said Ajit Mishra - SVP, Research at Religare Broking.Mishra advised traders to adjust their positions based on these levels.(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)

title: 2024 festive season sees highest gig workers demand driven by logistics, retail sectors: Report
description: Mumbai: Over 12 lakh gig or freelance roles were posted during the 2024 festive season, which is 23 per cent more than last year driven by the rise of e-commerce, tech advancements, and the transition to flexible, on-demand roles post-pandemic, a report said on Tuesday.  This demand is primarily driven by a booming retail environment, evolving customer expectations, increased consumer spending, the expansion of e-commerce, and the growing trend of 'just-in-time' hiring, said the report.  "This festive season, over 1.2 million gig roles were posted. We're seeing more than just a spike in gig roles - it's a transformation in how people and companies are approaching work," end-to-end recruitment solutions provider Avsar founder and CEO Navneet Singh said quoting its report - 'Gig Workers Report'.  The report is based on an analysis of data collected from Avsar's platform, covering key sectors such as logistics, retail, e-commerce, and customer support, with a focus on geographic demand shifts between metro and tier II cities.  Tier II cities like Surat, Jaipur, and Lucknow are rapidly becoming key hubs for gig hiring, showing a strong demand, while metro cities like Mumbai, Delhi NCR, and Bengaluru still lead in overall numbers, accounting for 53 per cent of the demand, it said.  The shift toward tier II cities highlights the expanding reach of the gig economy beyond traditional urban areas, added the report.  According to the report to attract talent in a competitive market, companies are offering higher pay for gig roles this season.  Field technicians can earn up to Rs 35,000 monthly, while customer support executives and delivery personnel earn between Rs 18,000 and Rs 28,000.  This rise in pay reflects a combination of factors, including a shortage of skilled workers in high-demand roles and the need for businesses to meet rising service expectations during the festive season, making gig work more appealing for skilled professionals, it said.  Logistics, retail, and customer support roles dominate this season's demand, it said.  Logistics roles account for 35 per cent of all gig jobs, followed by retail and e-commerce at 28 per cent, and customer support at 15 per cent.  "It's exciting to see gig work becoming a viable, long-term career path for many, with roles that also reflect growing values around sustainability. We believe the gig economy is evolving into something lasting and impactful for India's workforce," Singh added.

title: Nasdaq futures climb as traders await Nvidia earnings: Live updates
description: Sunday's move follows a tough week for the three major benchmarks, which are now off their highs that were seen in the aftermath of Trump's victory.

title: Biden allows Ukraine to use U.S. arms to strike inside Russia

description: Tencent Cloud is increasingly leveraging the WeChat ecosystem to set itself apart from competitors, CEO Dowson Tong said.

description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Sunday he will appoint Brendan Carr, a critic of Biden's telecom policies and Big Tech, as FCC chairman.

On today's show, Will Peck, head of digital assets at WisdomTree, discusses what a national bitcoin stockpile could mean for prices and the future of crypto-focused ETFs.
